TAXONOMIC CLASS.content:
TAXONOMIC CLASS: Fine-loamy, mixed, superactive, frigid Torrifluventic Haploxerolls
Haploxerolls.

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Paul silty clay loam - cultivated.  (Colors are for dry
soil unless otherwise noted.)
Apl--0 to 5 inches; reddish gray (5YR 5/2) silty clay loam, dark
reddish brown (5YR 3/2) moist; strong fine angular blocky structure;
hard, friable, sticky and plastic; common fine and very fine roots;
moderately calcareous; mildly alkaline (pH 7.6); clear smooth
boundary.  (4 to 6 inches thick)
Ap2--5 to l3 inches; reddish brown (5YR 5/3) silty clay loam, dark
reddish brown (5YR 3/2) moist; strong medium angular blocky structure;
hard, friable, sticky and plastic; common fine and very fine roots;
moderately calcareous; mildly alkaline (pH 7.6); clear smooth
boundary.  (8 to l2 inches thick)
B2ca--l3 to 45 inches; light reddish brown (5YR 6/3) silty clay
loam, reddish brown (5YR 4/3) moist; moderate coarse and medium
subangular blocky structure; hard, friable, sticky and plastic; few
fine and very fine roots; few fine and medium tubular pores; strongly
calcareous; moderately alkaline (pH 8.0); gradual smooth boundary.  (l4
to 32 inches thick)
Clca--45 to 58 inches; pale brown (l0YR 6/3) silt loam, yellowish
brown (l0YR 5/4) moist; weak coarse and medium subangular blocky
structure; slightly hard, very friable, sticky and plastic; few very
fine roots; few fine and medium tubular pores; strongly calcareous;
moderately alkaline (pH 8.2); clear smooth boundary.  (l3 to 20 inches
thick)
IIC2ca--58 to 60 inches; very gravelly coarse sand; lime coated
gravels and cobbles; 80 percent gravel, l0 percent cobble.

TYPE LOCATION.content:
TYPE LOCATION:  Bonneville County, Idaho; 4 miles northeast of Idaho
Falls, approximately l320 feet west and 200 feet north of the southeast
corner of section 36, T. 3 N., R. 38 E.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  The mean annual soil temperature ranges from
43 to 47 degrees F, and the mean summer temperature from 62 to 67
degrees F.  The l0 to 40 inch control section is predominantly silty
clay loam or silt loam averaging 23 to 35 percent clay, more than l5
percent coarser than very fine sand and less than l5 percent gravel.
The mollic epipedon is l2 to l8 inches thick.  Reaction of the profile
is mildly or moderately alkaline.
The A horizons have hue of 7.5YR or 5YR, value 4 or 5 dry, 2 or 3
moist, and chroma of 2 or 3.  It is silty clay loam, silt loam or sandy
loam.
The B horizon has hue of 7.5YR or 5YR, value of 4 through 6 dry, 3 or 4
moist, and chroma of 2 or 3.  It is silty clay loam or silt loam.
The C horizons have value of 6 or 7 dry, 5 or 6 moist, and chroma of 2
through 4.  It is dominantly silty clay loam or silt loam, with very
gravelly coarse sands in the lower part.

COMPETING SERIES.content:
COMPETING SERIES:  There are no other soils listed in the same family.
Similar soils are the Paesl series.  Paesl soils have contrasting
layers of sand and gravel at depths of less than 40 inches.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content:
GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  The Paul soils are on alluvial fans and river
terraces at elevations of 4,500 to 5,000 feet.  Slopes are 0 to 2
percent but dominantly less than l percent.  This soil formed in
alluvium from mixed sources, but mainly from sandstone and limestone.
The frost-free season is 90 to l20 days.  The mean annual precipitation
ranges from l0 to l2 inches.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content:
GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Ammon, Bannock, and
Paesl soils.  Ammon soils have less than l5 percent coarser than very
fine sand in their textural control sections.  Bannock and Paesl soils
are less than 40 inches to contrasting layers of sand and gravel.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content:
DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Well drained; slow runoff; moderately slow
permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content:
USE AND VEGETATION:  Nearly all of this soil is irrigated.  Alfalfa,
small grains, sugar beets, potatoes, and pasture are the main crops
grown.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content:
DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Southeastern Idaho.  The series is moderately
extensive.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Portland, Oregon

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:  The type location and classification have been changed, in
this description, from that found on the January, l973 official series
description of the Paul series.  The January, l973 classification was
fine-loamy, mixed, frigid Aridic Calcixerolls.
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.
